normalized: earth year 2256 a.
d.
, space era year 46, new space era year 2.
october 29, early in the morning.
the battleship, tristan, arrived at a small port-town on the outskirts of perseus city, right on schedule.
as of now, i, donny bohgan, had donned the identity of colonel celio adamo of the libra armed forces,
i stood in line with my men to welcome the empress, beatrice kushan, who was about to board my ship with her party of subordinates.
my expectation was that the small harbour town would be crowded with the soldiers of her guard, but it quickly dissipated after i noticed only a minimal amount of her soldiers guarding it.
i heard the whispers of some of my subordinates, 『we could plan to kidnap them at the harbour』, and even though i was stunned by the slack defences on show,
i had seen the cunning and terror that exuded from beatrice and kila first-hand.
i told my men sharply, 『never underestimate the empress and the grim reaper』, in order to reinforce their vigilance levels.

name: hans
normalized: … my lord.
the widow eater, major hans, who had become my assistant in place of muller who had been killed in action, whispered to me.

name: bohgan
normalized: what is it?

name: hans
normalized: it is regarding the four elders’ general moller of the neo-terras…

name: bohgan
normalized: don’t worry, moller has really come here on mars.

name: bohgan
normalized: otherwise, the empress would have suspected a trap for certain.
the old man had also obtained her consent, as i had suggested to him.

name: hans
normalized: excuse me, it isn’t the place of us lower officials to worry about it.
as you will, my lord.

name: bohgan
normalized: on one hand, we will degrade the kushan mother and daughter here, as revenge, and on the other hand, kill that old man with a dagger to his back.
even though breaking the old man with brainwashing is a feasible option, it isn’t really a hobby of mine.

name: hans
normalized: i agree.
the director of our brainwashing laboratory grinned.

name: bohgan
normalized: they are here.
i am the colonel now.

name: hans
normalized: yes.
i reminded him just in case, to make sure he wouldn’t address me as “lord”.
an imported black car came to a halt on the docks.
the empress and her daughter appeared.
their security was remarkably thin,

name: bohgan
normalized: (it has been too long… you bloody mother and daughter.
now, it is my time…)
the right arm, which i had lost, started aching.
i stopped myself from rubbing my aching arm unconsciously.
even a few suspicious movements would spell death for all of us at the hands of these fierce opponents.
i smiled and greeted them cordially, along with all of their lined up forces, as colonel celio adamo of the libra armed forces.

name: bohgan
normalized: commodore, we meet at last.
i am captain celio adamo.

name: beatrice
normalized: are you colonel adamo of the libra armed forces?
please treat with us courteously on this brief voyage.
beatrice nodded respectfully.
even though i was keeping my courteous attitude for now, it was all because i didn’t want them to know what i was thinking within the depths of my heart.

name: bohgan
normalized: (just you wait, i will give you the same courtesy you so graciously offered me… kukuku)

name: bohgan
normalized: well then, let us proceed to my ship, if you please.
having said so, i tried to guide beatrice to the tristan,

name: kila
normalized: please give me a moment.
the annoying little girl interrupted me suddenly.

name: bohgan
normalized: what is it?

name: kila
normalized: i am lieutenant kila kushan, in charge of the personal security of commodore beatrice kushan.
kila saluted me.

name: bohgan
normalized: i know that, what of it?

name: kila
normalized: i am requesting the dna testing of all of the crew members of your ship, the tristan.

name: kila
normalized: our medical team is already prepared for it, and we are ready to complete the inspection.

name: kila
normalized: if the captain of this ship, colonel adamo, allows it then we shall begin right away.

name: bohgan
normalized: (dna testing…?
what a troublesome brat the grim reaper is!
i was just about to click my tongue in annoyance, but stopped myself in the nick of time.

name: bohgan
normalized: that is an unexpected request.
however, what exactly are you looking for in this inspection of yours?
when i asked that, kila responded,

name: kila
normalized: we are in the process of acquiring the military registration data for all of the officers of the libra armed forces.
and obviously, that includes dna data which counts as medical information.

name: kila
normalized: from this information, we will be able to ascertain whether all the crew members of your ship, the tristan, are indeed themselves or not.

name: kila
normalized: of course, that includes you too, colonel adamo.
now captain, if you please.
kila said so and looked at me.

name: bohgan
normalized: (tch… damn it.
military registration data was classified as confidential, and that meant that it couldn’t be obtained by regular means.
it was evident that the kushan armed forces had been working on collecting information on the libra armed forces.
however, it didn’t matter.
she declared it in a dignified manner, however she was trying to ascertain that all my crew members were genuine and had taken steps to make sure that we couldn’t circumvent this inspection.
this brazen act of hers could be considered an act of war.
however, i had anticipated this kind of behaviour from these bloody women.
there had been a saying, not too long in the past,
―― the end justifies the means, no matter how dastardly it is.
however, i had always found it to be terribly classless.
and so, as i was thinking about my next course of action.
zoosh!
a spray of sand blew up and huge machines appeared from the sand sea.
4 armoured-mounts surrounded my ship, the tristan.
it was a blatant act to demonstrate their show of force.

name: bohgan
normalized: (and now, there is this…)

name: bohgan
normalized: commodore, this is a clear infringement on the sovereignty of our nation!
i roared.
i said that while donning the face of a neutral libra soldier, whose pride had been hurt.
however, beatrice didn’t even move her eyebrows.
on the contrary, she just glared at me with disdainful eyes.

name: beatrice
normalized: captain adamo, my daughter’s mind is preoccupied with my safety.
please allow it.

name: bohgan
normalized: but…

name: beatrice
normalized: however, captain, don’t misunderstand me.
i am not asking you, i am ordering you.
beatrice said that arrogantly.

name: bohgan
normalized: (tch.
will i really have to permit this here?
if i opposed her tactlessly, then she could just say, 『you should allow the inspections, since you have nothing to hide.

name: bohgan
normalized: (this arrogant woman and her bloody daughter…)

name: bohgan
normalized: kuh… y-yes.
i had to show myself to be a proud and responsible high-ranking libra military officer, even though i was cursing them within my heart.
i nodded in agreement at the frustrating outcome.

name: beatrice
normalized: well then, you may lead us on, captain.
we will requisition the infirmary of this ship for the dna testing.

name: bohgan
normalized: i understand.

name: kila
normalized: please debrief your crew thoroughly.
if they dare to make any suspicious movements, i will shoot them dead without mercy.
the grim reaper kila’s eyes were shining ominously.
this woman was actually hoping for it, contrary to her warning.
it really felt like this mother and her daughter were spewing their locked up resentment in order to provoke a reaction out of us, like homicidal sociopaths.
it took them about 3 hours to do the dna testing.
and then――
kila came to the captain’s quarters in the afternoon, having seemingly finished carrying out the dna tests of all my crew members.
i already knew the results.

name: bohgan
normalized: so lieutenant kushan… are you satisfied with the innocence of my forces?

name: kila
normalized: yes, there seem to be no problems with regards to the crew members of the tristan.

name: bohgan
normalized: that is good to hear.

name: hans
normalized: that is a relief.
nevertheless, you are exactly how i expected the daughter of the empress to be.

name: hans
normalized: henceforth, i will be sure to carry out the dna testing of all of our crew members.
i would be honoured to follow the example you have set in our first meeting, and adopt similar caution that you have shown towards us today.

name: kila
normalized: naturally.
kira didn’t tear down our arrogance, and merely absorbed hans’s and my obvious and brazen use of sarcasm with her thick skin.

name: bohgan
normalized: (however, that was really disappointing of you… grim reaper)
i had also learnt somethings about them during my defeat.
namely, the methods that these women would use, while drawing on their tenacious feminine temperament.
as a result, all the registration data of the libra soldiers had been tampered with in advance, in case this type of situation ever arose.
they would never find anything suspicious on us, no matter how many dna tests they carried out.

name: bohgan
normalized: well, lieutenant, can――
kila cut me off, just as i was about to say, 『can we have our meeting now?

name: kila
normalized: there is one last inspection.

name: bohgan
normalized: yes?
kila took out a small vial from within her bosom.
its contents were red.

name: bohgan
normalized: (is that… blood?

name: bohgan
normalized: is that… a blood sample?
my curiosity got the better of me and i asked her that, when beatrice intervened,

name: beatrice
normalized: we are pursuing a man.
and we suspect that you are that man, captain.
her words engulfed my heart.

name: bohgan
normalized: hngh!?
w-what do you mean…?

name: bohgan
normalized: (n-no way.
do these women… know my true identity again!?
my heart started beating heavily within my chest.
a lot of sweat began to stream down my forehead.
it wasn’t simply due to my nervousness.

name: bohgan
normalized: (keep calm.
the preparations were perfect.
it is impossible for my real identity to be exposed.

name: kila
normalized: captain, your right arm is a prosthetic, isn’t it?
kila spit out those sharp words, like a knife.

name: bohgan
normalized: (my prosthetic!?
why does this girl care about that?
still――)

name: bohgan
normalized: eh!?
y-yes, that is correct.
i-it was also registered in libra’s military medical records…

name: kila
normalized: an honourable injury in an aviation battle on libra’s perimeter, five years ago.

name: bohgan
normalized: w-well yes… anyway, is that all?

name: bohgan
normalized: (tch… she has done her investigation well.

name: kila
normalized: the man we are pursuing also has a prosthetic arm now.

name: kila
normalized: it is in the same place as yours, captain.
i sliced it off myself, so it stands to reason that i should know about it well♪

name: bohgan
normalized: … hngh!?
kila stared at my prosthetic arm, with eyes similar to how a cat looks at a slithering rat.

name: bohgan
normalized: very funny… hahaha…
i said so, while sweating profusely.
it wasn’t an act.

name: kila
normalized: i am kidding♪
kila smiled at me.

name: bohgan
normalized: … huh?

name: kila
normalized: i checked it already, however, it didn’t match.
she smiled at me sweetly.
she had the face of someone who was truly joking.

name: bohgan
normalized: (this bloody woman!

name: bohgan
normalized: t-that was good… you really got me.
i patted my chest and gave her a vague smile.

name: beatrice
normalized: kila, refrain yourself from cracking mean jokes like this.

name: kila
normalized: excuse me, mother, however, when i saw his prosthetic arm, i just couldn’t help myself.

name: beatrice
normalized: i understand, but you went too far.
excuse us, colonel adamo.

name: kila
normalized: please, excuse me.
she looked really pretty when saying that and as she prepared to leave, i pushed my tongue out in relief.
i really wanted to strangle someone’s neck right about now.

name: kila
normalized: also, colonel adamo――
the bloody woman opened her mouth again.

name: bohgan
normalized: what do you want now?
was she still in the mood for more?
i listened to her while feeling sick in my stomach.

name: kila
normalized: as a result of the dna testing, i know that you are in a bad condition now.

name: bohgan
normalized: (tch.
there are plenty reasons for that!

name: bohgan
normalized: yes… it is my leukaemia.
i calmed down and answered.

name: kila
normalized: you know about it?

name: beatrice
normalized: is it true, colonel?

name: bohgan
normalized: i have been trying to be careful, however, constantly going back and forth between mars and space… hah… it is embarrassing.

name: beatrice
normalized: it is an occupational hazard.

name: kila
normalized: the symptoms don’t seem to have progressed yet, however, you should get yourself treated as soon as possible.

name: beatrice
normalized: indeed.
in case of an emergency on your part, it could end up interfering with my mission.
both of them said so.
a long time ago, leukaemia had been an incurable disease.
however, there were methods to completely cure it now.
sure, it wasn’t a good disease to leave untreated, however, they didn’t even bother to show any courtesy to this sensitive subject and continued to talk about it brazenly.
on top of that, i was getting annoyed on noticing the uppity bitch make a worried face for a man she barely even knew.

name: bohgan
normalized: thank you for your concern.
i intend to take a small vacation after the conclusion of this mission.

name: beatrice
normalized: alright.
well then, i request you take suitable care of us until we reach libra.

name: kila
normalized: excuse me.
the empress and the grim reaper said so and left the captain’s quarters.

name: bohgan
normalized: (… phew)

name: bohgan
normalized: (the preparations are now complete.
i felt relief on overseeing the events transpire exactly as per my expectations.
at the same time, the uncomfortable feeling of restraining my pent-up lust became unbearable.

name: bohgan
normalized: kuuh…
my knees gave out and i fell down on the spot.

name: hans
normalized: captain, we have to treat you immediately!
hans rushed over to me.

name: bohgan
normalized: argh!
i am in a terrible mood now.
i spat those words out.
my blood sample, which the empress and the grim reaper possessed from way back.
why hadn’t it matched with mine?
obviously, there was a reason for that.
these women had gotten a hold of my blood sample during the arcadia naval war, as a result of which they had the means to expose my true identity.
and so, it had been necessary for me to take measures against it.
i had voluntarily administered a powerful radioactive drug into myself, in an attempt to mask the dna information of my blood.

name: bohgan
normalized: i have deceived them successfully.

name: hans
normalized: that was magnificent, captain!
however, those bloody women have been really cautious so far…

name: bohgan
normalized: hadn’t i told you?
kuku… by the way tell olov, that it has worked perfectly on me.

name: hans
normalized: it seems to be a by-product created during the development of a remodelling drug that manipulates a female’s genes to alter parts of her body.

name: bohgan
normalized: he is truly the genius of our brainwashing laboratory…

name: hans
normalized: those bloody women are within our grasp now.
my deputy raised an enraptured voice, as if he had been stung by a nail.

name: bohgan
normalized: not yet.
don’t be careless, hans.

name: bohgan
normalized: however, this was a step towards our victory.

name: bohgan
normalized: understood?
keep a thorough check on them and monitor them constantly.
don’t overlook any seemingly trivial actions or behaviour on their part.

name: bohgan
normalized: don’t be careless until we get to brainwashing them.

name: bohgan
normalized: that is the only path to our thorough victory.
the severe side-effects of the powerful drug had eaten into my body.
it had come to attention recently, that my lifespan had decreased by quite a few years because of it.
however, it was worth it for doing this.
finally, i had succeeded in imprisoning the accursed women, the empress and the grim reaper.
the prison battleship was going to depart soon.
